Description: A vestibular disorder characterized by brief episodes of vertigo (a sensation of spinning) triggered by specific changes in head position. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid sudden head movements. Use caution during activities that may provoke symptoms. Consider vestibular rehabilitation exercises as recommended by a healthcare professional. Undergo canalith repositioning maneuvers (like the Epley maneuver) performed by a healthcare provider. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: An abnormal enlargement of the aorta, the main blood vessel that runs from the heart through the abdomen. It can be life-threatening if it ruptures. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Regular screening for individuals at higher risk (e.g., older men with a history of smoking). Management of blood pressure and cholesterol levels. Smoking cessation. Surgical repair (open or endovascular) if the aneurysm is large or rapidly growing. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A skin condition characterized by areas of dark, velvety discoloration in body folds and creases. It's often associated with insulin resistance, obesity, or hormonal disorders. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Address underlying conditions like diabetes or obesity through lifestyle changes and medical management. Maintain a healthy weight. Consult a dermatologist for diagnosis and management of skin symptoms. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A rare disorder that makes it difficult for food and liquid to pass into the stomach. It occurs when the lower esophageal sphincter (LES) fails to relax properly, and the muscles in the esophagus don't contract normally. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Eat slowly and chew food thoroughly. Avoid lying down immediately after eating. Elevate the head of the bed. Consider medical treatments such as pneumatic dilation, botulinum toxin injection, or surgery (Heller myotomy). Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: An overuse injury of the Achilles tendon, the large tendon that connects the calf muscles to the heel bone. It causes pain and stiffness along the tendon and in the back of the heel. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Proper warm-up before exercise. Gradual increase in exercise intensity. Wearing supportive footwear. Stretching the calf muscles regularly. Rest and ice application during flare-ups. Consider physical therapy. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A tear in the Achilles tendon, often occurring during sudden, forceful movements. It usually causes sudden, severe pain in the back of the ankle and difficulty walking. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Proper warm-up before exercise. Avoid overtraining. Address Achilles tendinitis promptly to prevent weakening of the tendon. Seek immediate medical attention if a rupture is suspected; treatment often involves surgery or immobilization. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A tear or sprain of the anterior cruciate ligament (ACL), one of the major ligaments in the knee. ACL injuries often occur during sports that involve sudden stops or changes in direction. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Proper warm-up and stretching before physical activity. Use of proper sports techniques. Strengthening the muscles around the knee. Wearing appropriate protective gear. Consider physical therapy and potentially surgery for treatment. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells. It can cause pimples, blackheads, whiteheads, and deeper lumps. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Gentle skin cleansing. Avoid picking or squeezing blemishes. Use non-comedogenic skincare products. Consider over-the-counter or prescription topical and oral medications. Consult a dermatologist for persistent or severe acne. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A noncancerous tumor that develops on the main nerve leading from the inner ear to the brain. It can cause hearing loss, tinnitus (ringing in the ear), and dizziness. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There are no known ways to prevent acoustic neuromas. Early detection through audiological testing and MRI if symptoms arise. Management options include observation, surgery, or radiation therapy depending on the tumor size and patient factors. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A hormonal disorder that results from too much growth hormone (GH) in the body. In adults, this leads to the enlargement of bones in the hands, feet, and face. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Early diagnosis and treatment are crucial to manage symptoms and prevent complications. Regular monitoring of GH levels. Treatment options include surgery, medication, and radiation therapy. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Rough, scaly patches on the skin caused by years of sun exposure. They are considered precancerous and can potentially develop into squamous cell carcinoma. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Protect skin from sun exposure by using sunscreen, wearing protective clothing, and seeking shade. Regular skin checks by a dermatologist. Treatment options include cryotherapy, topical medications, and surgical removal. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A range of conditions that suddenly reduce blood flow to the heart. The most common cause is plaque rupture or blood clot formation in the coronary arteries. It includes unstable angina and myocardial infarction (heart attack). It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Maintain a healthy lifestyle: balanced diet, regular exercise, avoid smoking. Manage risk factors such as high blood pressure, high cholesterol, and diabetes. Seek immediate medical attention for chest pain or other symptoms of a heart attack. Follow prescribed medications. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A rare but serious condition that affects the nervous system, specifically the gray matter of the spinal cord, causing muscles and reflexes to become weak or paralyzed. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: The exact causes are not fully understood, making prevention challenging. Practicing good hygiene, such as frequent handwashing, may help reduce the risk of viral infections that could be triggers. Prompt medical evaluation for sudden onset of limb weakness or paralysis. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A rare condition in which the liver rapidly loses its function, often developing over days or weeks. It can be caused by viral hepatitis, drug overdose, or other conditions. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid excessive alcohol consumption. Use medications (especially over-the-counter) as directed. Get vaccinated against hepatitis A and B. Seek immediate medical attention for symptoms of liver failure (e.g., jaundice, confusion). Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A type of cancer of the blood and bone marrow that affects white blood cells called lymphocytes. It progresses rapidly and requires aggressive treatment. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There are no known ways to prevent most cases of ALL. Early diagnosis and prompt treatment (chemotherapy, radiation therapy, stem cell transplant) are crucial. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A type of cancer of the blood and bone marrow characterized by the rapid growth of abnormal myeloid cells that accumulate in the bone marrow and interfere with the production of normal blood cells. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There are no known ways to prevent most cases of AML. Early diagnosis and prompt treatment (chemotherapy, stem cell transplant) are essential. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Inflammation of the sinuses that lasts for a short time (usually less than 4 weeks). It's often caused by a viral infection. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Practice good hygiene to prevent viral infections (frequent handwashing). Avoid irritants like smoke and pollutants. Use saline nasal sprays to keep nasal passages moist. Seek medical advice if symptoms are severe or don't improve. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A rare endocrine disorder in which the adrenal glands don't produce enough of certain hormones, particularly cortisol and aldosterone. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There is no known way to prevent Addison's disease. Individuals with Addison's disease need lifelong hormone replacement therapy. Carry an emergency hydrocortisone injection for adrenal crises. Wear a medical identification bracelet. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A condition in which the inner lining of the uterus (endometrium) grows into the muscular wall of the uterus (myometrium). It can cause heavy periods, pelvic pain, and an enlarged uterus. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There are no known ways to prevent adenomyosis. Management options include pain relievers, hormonal therapies, and in some cases, hysterectomy. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder is a neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by inattention, hyperactivity, and impulsivity. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: While the exact causes are not fully understood, early diagnosis and intervention are key. Treatment often involves a combination of medication, therapy (behavioral therapy, cognitive behavioral therapy), and educational support. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Mental health conditions that occur when you have difficulty coping with a specific stressful life event, such as a job loss, relationship breakdown, or illness. Symptoms include sadness, anxiety, and difficulty concentrating. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Develop healthy coping mechanisms for stress (e.g., exercise, relaxation techniques). Seek support from friends, family, or support groups. Consider therapy or counseling to help navigate stressful life events. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A rare cancer that forms in the adrenal glands, small organs located on top of each kidney. It can cause hormonal imbalances and may spread to other parts of the body. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There are no known ways to prevent most adrenal cancers. Early detection through imaging tests if symptoms or risk factors are present. Treatment options include surgery, chemotherapy, and radiation therapy. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder that persists into adulthood. Symptoms can manifest differently than in childhood, often involving difficulties with organization, time management, and emotional regulation. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Early diagnosis and intervention in childhood can help individuals develop coping strategies. Treatment in adulthood often involves medication, therapy (cognitive behavioral therapy, coaching), and lifestyle adjustments. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Heart defects that were present at birth and persist into adulthood. The complexity and severity of these defects vary widely. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Regular follow-up with a cardiologist specializing in congenital heart disease. Adherence to prescribed medications. Lifestyle modifications as recommended by the cardiologist. Awareness of potential complications and when to seek medical attention. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A rare inflammatory disorder characterized by high fevers, a salmon-pink rash, and joint pain. The cause is unknown. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There are no known ways to prevent Adult Still's disease. Treatment focuses on managing inflammation and symptoms with medications such as NSAIDs, corticosteroids, and disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs). Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Flat, brown spots on the skin that appear in areas most exposed to the sun, such as the face, hands, and arms. They are a sign of sun damage. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Protect skin from sun exposure by using sunscreen, wearing protective clothing, and seeking shade. Regular use of sunscreen can help prevent new age spots. Cosmetic treatments are available to reduce their appearance. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A type of anxiety disorder in which you fear and avoid places or situations that might cause you to panic, feel trapped, helpless, or embarrassed. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Seek therapy, particularly cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) and exposure therapy. Consider medication as prescribed by a psychiatrist. Gradually expose yourself to feared situations with support. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Acquired immunodeficiency syndrome is the late stage of HIV infection that occurs when the body's immune system is severely damaged. It makes individuals susceptible to opportunistic infections and certain cancers. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Practice safe sex (consistent and correct use of condoms). Avoid sharing needles. Get tested for HIV if you are at risk. If HIV-positive, start antiretroviral therapy (ART) as early as possible to prevent progression to AIDS. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A condition that occurs when the air pressure in the middle ear and the air pressure outside the ear are not equal. This can cause pain, pressure, and temporary hearing loss, often during airplane ascent or descent. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Swallow, yawn, or chew gum during ascent and descent. Use decongestant nasal sprays or oral decongestants before flying (consult a doctor). Consider earplugs designed for flying. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A group of inherited disorders that result in little or no production of the pigment melanin, which determines the color of skin, hair, and eyes. It's associated with vision problems and increased risk of skin cancer. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Protect skin and eyes from sun exposure with sunscreen, protective clothing, and sunglasses. Regular eye exams are crucial to manage vision problems. Be aware of the increased risk of skin cancer and perform regular self-exams and dermatologist visits. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A genetic condition in which the body cannot break down alcohol properly, leading to symptoms like facial flushing, nausea, headache, and rapid heartbeat after consuming even small amounts of alcohol. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid alcohol consumption. Be mindful of hidden alcohol in foods and beverages. Inform healthcare providers about the intolerance. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A serious and sometimes deadly consequence of drinking large amounts of alcohol quickly. It can affect breathing, heart rate, body temperature, and gag reflex. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Drink alcohol in moderation. Sip drinks slowly. Avoid drinking on an empty stomach. Be aware of the alcohol content of drinks. Never leave someone who has drunk a lot of alcohol alone. Seek immediate medical help if someone shows signs of alcohol poisoning. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A pattern of alcohol use that involves problems controlling your drinking, being preoccupied with alcohol, continuing to use alcohol even when it causes problems, having to drink more to get the same effect, or having withdrawal symptoms when you rapidly decrease or stop drinking. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Seek professional help through therapy, support groups, and sometimes medication. Avoid situations that trigger drinking. Develop healthy coping mechanisms for stress. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Inflammation of the liver caused by heavy alcohol use over many years. It can range from mild to severe and can lead to liver failure. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Stop drinking alcohol completely. Maintain a healthy diet if possible. Seek medical treatment, which may include corticosteroids in severe cases. Liver transplantation may be an option for some individuals with severe alcoholic hepatitis. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Conditions in which your immune system reacts abnormally to a foreign substance (allergen). These reactions can cause a range of symptoms, from mild skin rashes to life-threatening anaphylaxis. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Identify and avoid known allergens. Take prescribed or over-the-counter antihistamines or other medications as needed. Carry an epinephrine auto-injector (EpiPen) if you have a history of severe allergic reactions. Consider allergy testing and immunotherapy (allergy shots or sublingual tablets). Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A specific type of hypersensitivity reaction in which the body's immune system overreacts to a harmless substance (allergen). It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Identify and avoid specific allergens. Use medications like antihistamines, corticosteroids, or mast cell stabilizers as prescribed or over the counter. Carry an epinephrine auto-injector for severe allergies. Consider allergy testing and immunotherapy. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A type of food allergy to red meat (beef, pork, lamb, venison) and other mammal products. It's triggered by a bite from the lone star tick (in the US) or other ticks. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid consumption of red meat and other mammal products. Read food labels carefully. Carry an epinephrine auto-injector if you have a history of severe reactions. Consult an allergist for diagnosis and management. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A progressive neurodegenerative disease that gradually destroys memory and thinking skills, and eventually the ability to carry out the simplest tasks. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: While there is no known way to prevent Alzheimer's, adopting a healthy lifestyle (balanced diet, regular exercise, social engagement, mental stimulation) may reduce risk. Early diagnosis and treatment can help manage symptoms. Support for caregivers is crucial. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A rare condition in which a newborn's external genitals don't appear clearly male or female. It requires medical evaluation to determine the underlying cause and appropriate management. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: This is not a condition that can be prevented. Prompt medical evaluation and diagnosis by a multidisciplinary team are essential. Management may involve hormone therapy and/or surgery, along with psychological support. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A rare, usually noncancerous (benign) tumor that most often develops in the jaw. It can grow aggressively and cause swelling, pain, and displacement of teeth. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There are no known ways to prevent ameloblastoma. Early detection through dental exams and imaging (X-rays, CT scans) is important. Treatment typically involves surgical removal of the tumor. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: The absence of menstruation — one or more missed menstrual periods. It can be primary (never having a period by age 15) or secondary (periods stop for 3 months or more in someone who previously had them). It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Prevention depends on the underlying cause. Maintaining a healthy weight, managing stress, and addressing hormonal imbalances can help in some cases. Medical evaluation is necessary to determine the cause and appropriate treatment. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A loss of memory, usually caused by brain damage, illness, or severe psychological trauma. The memory loss can be partial or total, and temporary or permanent. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Prevention depends on the cause. Protecting the head from injury, managing neurological conditions, and addressing psychological trauma may help. Medical evaluation is necessary to determine the cause and appropriate treatment, which may include therapy and rehabilitation. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A rare cancer that forms in the area where the bile duct and the pancreatic duct join and empty into the small intestine (the ampulla of Vater). It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There are no specific known ways to prevent ampullary cancer. Early detection through imaging tests (CT scans, MRIs) and endoscopic procedures (ERCP) is important. Treatment typically involves surgery (Whipple procedure), and may include chemotherapy and radiation therapy. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A rare disease that occurs when an abnormal protein, called amyloid, builds up in your organs. The amyloid deposits can make it hard for the organs to work properly. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There are no known ways to prevent most types of amyloidosis. Early diagnosis and treatment are crucial to manage symptoms and prevent organ damage. Treatment options vary depending on the type of amyloidosis and may include chemotherapy, stem cell transplant, and medications to reduce amyloid production. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A relatively rare cancer that develops in the tissues of the anus, the opening at the end of the digestive tract through which stool leaves the body. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Practice safe sex to reduce the risk of HPV infection, a major risk factor. Get vaccinated against HPV. Regular anal Pap tests may be recommended for high-risk individuals. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A severe, potentially life-threatening allergic reaction that can occur within seconds or minutes of exposure to an allergen. Symptoms include difficulty breathing, hives, swelling, and a drop in blood pressure. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid known allergens meticulously. Carry an epinephrine auto-injector (EpiPen) at all times if you have a history of severe allergies. Wear a medical identification bracelet or necklace. Educate family and friends on how to administer epinephrine. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A condition in which you lack enough healthy red blood cells to carry adequate oxygen to your body's tissues. This can cause fatigue, weakness, and shortness of breath. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Prevention depends on the type of anemia. Ensure adequate intake of iron, vitamin B12, and folate through diet or supplements. Manage chronic diseases that can lead to anemia. Avoid exposure to toxins that can damage bone marrow. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Chest pain or discomfort caused when your heart muscle doesn't get enough oxygen-rich blood. It's usually a symptom of underlying heart disease. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Manage underlying heart conditions such as coronary artery disease. Maintain a healthy lifestyle: balanced diet, regular exercise, avoid smoking. Follow prescribed medications for heart conditions. Learn to recognize and avoid triggers of angina. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Swelling in the deep layers of the skin, often affecting the face, lips, tongue, throat, and genitals. It can be caused by allergic reactions, medications, or hereditary conditions. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid known triggers such as allergens or medications. Seek immediate medical attention for swelling that affects breathing. Individuals with hereditary angioedema may require specific prophylactic medications. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: An inflammatory disease that, over time, can cause some of the small bones in your spine (vertebrae) to fuse. This fusing makes the spine less flexible and can result in a hunched-forward posture. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There is no known way to prevent ankylosing spondylitis as it has a genetic component. Management focuses on relieving pain and stiffness, and maintaining mobility through medication, physical therapy, and exercise. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A collection of pus near the anus and rectum. It's usually the result of an infection of a small gland in the anus. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There are no specific ways to prevent anorectal abscesses. Maintaining good hygiene in the anal area may help reduce the risk of infection. Prompt treatment of any anal infections or discomfort is important. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: An eating disorder characterized by an abnormally low body weight, an intense fear of gaining weight, and a distorted perception of weight or shape. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Early identification and intervention are crucial. Treatment involves a multidisciplinary approach including medical care, nutritional rehabilitation, and psychotherapy. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: The partial or complete loss of the sense of smell. It can be temporary or permanent and can be caused by nasal congestion, nerve damage, or certain medical conditions. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Prevention depends on the cause. Avoid irritants that can damage the nasal passages. Seek prompt treatment for nasal infections or injuries. Protect the head from injury to prevent nerve damage. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A group of mental health conditions characterized by excessive worry, fear, nervousness, or unease about something with an uncertain outcome. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Develop healthy coping mechanisms for stress (e.g., exercise, relaxation techniques, mindfulness). Seek therapy, such as cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT). Consider medication as prescribed by a psychiatrist. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A serious condition in which the inner layer of the aorta, the large blood vessel branching off the heart, tears. Blood surges through the tear, causing the inner and middle layers of the aorta to separate (dissect). It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Manage high blood pressure aggressively. Quit smoking. Maintain a healthy weight. Treat underlying aortic conditions. Avoid heavy lifting or straining if you have risk factors. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A rare condition in which the body stops producing enough new blood cells. This can lead to fatigue, frequent infections, and easy bleeding. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid exposure to known toxins and radiation. Prompt treatment of underlying autoimmune diseases may help in some cases. In many cases, the cause is unknown, making prevention difficult. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Inflammation of the appendix, a finger-shaped pouch that projects from your colon on the lower right side of your abdomen. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There is no proven way to prevent appendicitis. Seek immediate medical attention for symptoms such as sudden pain that begins around the navel and then shifts to the lower right abdomen. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: An irregular heartbeat, which can be too fast (tachycardia), too slow (bradycardia), or erratic. Some arrhythmias are harmless, while others can be life-threatening. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Manage underlying heart conditions. Maintain a healthy lifestyle: balanced diet, regular exercise, avoid smoking. Limit caffeine and alcohol intake. Follow prescribed medications for heart conditions. Regular check-ups with a cardiologist are important. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: The thickening and hardening of the walls of the arteries, typically occurring in old age. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Maintain a healthy lifestyle: balanced diet low in saturated and trans fats, regular exercise, avoid smoking. Manage high blood pressure, high cholesterol, and diabetes. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Inflammation of one or more of your joints, causing pain and stiffness that can worsen with age. There are many different types of arthritis. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Prevention varies depending on the type of arthritis. Maintain a healthy weight, exercise regularly, avoid joint injuries, and manage underlying conditions. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A chronic lung disease caused by inhaling asbestos fibers. Prolonged exposure to asbestos can cause scarring of lung tissue and shortness of breath. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid exposure to asbestos. If you work in an occupation where asbestos exposure is possible, follow strict safety regulations and wear appropriate protective gear. Smoking increases the risk of asbestosis and its complications. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A developmental disorder that is now considered part of the autism spectrum disorder (ASD). It is characterized by difficulties with social interaction and communication, as well as restricted and repetitive patterns of behavior and interests. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: The exact causes are not fully understood, and there are no known ways to prevent ASD. Early diagnosis and intervention with therapies and support can help individuals develop skills and strategies to manage challenges. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A chronic respiratory condition in which your airways become inflamed and narrow, making it difficult to breathe. It can be triggered by allergens, irritants, exercise, and stress. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Identify and avoid known asthma triggers. Use prescribed inhalers and medications as directed. Develop an asthma action plan with your doctor. Monitor your symptoms regularly. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A specific type of arteriosclerosis in which plaque builds up inside your arteries, narrowing them and reducing blood flow. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Maintain a healthy lifestyle: balanced diet low in saturated and trans fats, regular exercise, avoid smoking. Manage high blood pressure, high cholesterol, and diabetes. Follow prescribed medications. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A common fungal infection of the feet that causes scaly, itchy rash, especially between the toes. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Keep feet clean and dry, especially between the toes. Wear breathable shoes and socks. Avoid walking barefoot in public places like locker rooms and swimming pools. Use antifungal powders or sprays preventively. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A common type of heart arrhythmia in which the upper chambers of the heart (atria) beat irregularly and rapidly. This can increase the risk of stroke, heart failure, and other complications. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Manage underlying heart conditions and risk factors such as high blood pressure, obesity, and sleep apnea. Maintain a healthy lifestyle. Follow prescribed medications, which may include blood thinners and medications to control heart rate or rhythm. Regular check-ups with a cardiologist are important. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by challenges with social communication and interaction, and restricted or repetitive behaviors or interests. The severity and presentation of ASD vary widely. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: The exact causes are not fully understood, and there are no known ways to prevent ASD. Early diagnosis and intervention with therapies and support tailored to the individual's needs are crucial for maximizing their potential. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A chronic disease in which the body's immune system attacks the liver, causing inflammation and damage. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: The exact causes are not fully understood, and there are no known ways to prevent autoimmune hepatitis. Treatment focuses on suppressing the immune system with medications such as corticosteroids and other immunosuppressants. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Pain felt in the back that may originate from muscles, nerves, bones, joints or other structures in the spine. It can be acute (sudden onset) or chronic (lasting more than three months). It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Maintain good posture while sitting and standing. Use proper lifting techniques. Maintain a healthy weight. Exercise regularly to strengthen back and abdominal muscles. Avoid prolonged sitting or standing. Ensure your mattress and pillows provide adequate support. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A common vaginal infection caused by an imbalance of the natural bacteria in the vagina. Symptoms may include a thin, grayish-white discharge with a fishy odor. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid douching, as it can disrupt the balance of bacteria in the vagina. Limit the number of sexual partners. Use condoms consistently. Avoid scented soaps and feminine hygiene products in the vaginal area. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Conditions that make you feel unsteady or dizzy, as if you are moving when you are not. They can be caused by inner ear problems, head injuries, certain medications, or other medical conditions. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Prevent head injuries by wearing appropriate protective gear during sports and other activities. Manage underlying medical conditions that can affect balance. Avoid medications that can cause dizziness as a side effect, if possible. Consider vestibular rehabilitation therapy for inner ear disorders. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A small fluid-filled sac that can form when the Bartholin's glands, located on each side of the vaginal opening, become blocked. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There are no specific ways to prevent Bartholin's cysts. Practicing good hygiene in the genital area may help reduce the risk of infection. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A condition that causes sudden weakness or paralysis of one side of the face. It's thought to be due to swelling and inflammation of the nerve that controls facial muscles. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: The exact cause is not fully understood, and there are no known ways to prevent Bell's palsy. Treatment often involves corticosteroids to reduce inflammation, and most people recover fully within a few weeks or months. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: An enlargement of the prostate gland, a common condition as men age. It can cause urinary problems such as frequent urination, difficulty starting urination, and a weak urine stream. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There are no proven ways to prevent BPH. Maintaining a healthy lifestyle, including regular exercise and a balanced diet, may be beneficial overall. Regular check-ups with a doctor are important for early detection and management. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A serious eating disorder in which you frequently consume unusually large amounts of food and feel unable to stop eating. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Early identification and intervention are crucial. Treatment involves a multidisciplinary approach including psychotherapy (especially cognitive behavioral therapy), nutritional counseling, and sometimes medication. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A mental health condition that causes extreme shifts in mood, energy, activity levels, concentration, and the ability to carry out day-to-day tasks. These shifts include periods of intense highs (mania or hypomania) and lows (depression). It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: While there is no known way to prevent bipolar disorder, early diagnosis and consistent treatment are crucial for managing the condition. Treatment typically involves a combination of medication (mood stabilizers, antipsychotics), psychotherapy, and lifestyle management. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Abnormalities present at birth that can affect the structure or function of the body. They can range from mild to severe. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Many birth defects cannot be prevented, but some risk factors can be reduced by: ensuring adequate folic acid intake during pregnancy, avoiding alcohol and smoking during pregnancy, managing pre-existing medical conditions like diabetes, and getting recommended vaccinations before or during pregnancy. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Cancer that begins in the cells lining the inside of the bladder. It's more common in older adults and smokers. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Quit smoking. Stay hydrated by drinking plenty of fluids. Avoid exposure to certain chemicals used in some industries. Regular check-ups with a doctor may help in early detection for high-risk individuals. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Inflammation of the eyelids that can cause redness, itching, burning, and crusting along the lash line. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Practice good eyelid hygiene: warm compresses and gentle scrubbing of the eyelids can help manage symptoms and prevent flare-ups. Avoid eye makeup during flare-ups. Regular cleaning of contact lenses is important for contact lens wearers. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A thickened mass of blood formed by platelets and fibrin. They can be beneficial to stop bleeding but can also form inappropriately inside blood vessels, blocking blood flow and leading to serious complications. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Prevention depends on the risk factors. Stay active, especially during long periods of sitting or travel. Maintain a healthy weight. Manage underlying conditions like heart disease and diabetes. Follow prescribed blood-thinning medications if you are at high risk. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A rare type of cancer that begins in the bones. It can occur in any bone in the body, but most commonly affects the long bones of the arms and legs. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There are no known ways to prevent most primary bone cancers. Genetic counseling may be recommended for individuals with a family history of certain bone cancer syndromes. Early detection through imaging tests if symptoms arise is important. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A mental health disorder characterized by unstable moods, behavior, self-image, and functioning. People with BPD often experience intense and rapidly changing emotions and may have difficulty with relationships. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: While there is no known way to prevent BPD, early diagnosis and consistent treatment are crucial for managing the condition. Treatment typically involves psychotherapy (especially dialectical behavior therapy - DBT), and sometimes medication to manage specific symptoms. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A rare and potentially fatal illness caused by a toxin produced by a bacterium called Clostridium botulinum. It can occur from contaminated food, wound infections, or in infants. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Proper food handling and preservation techniques are crucial for preventing foodborne botulism. Seek immediate medical attention for any signs of botulism, such as difficulty swallowing or breathing, muscle weakness, and paralysis. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A condition in which the airways in the lungs become abnormally widened and thickened, leading to a buildup of mucus that can make the lungs more prone to infection. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Prevent childhood lung infections through vaccination and prompt treatment. Avoid smoking and exposure to lung irritants. Manage underlying conditions like cystic fibrosis or immune deficiencies that can increase the risk. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Inflammation of the bronchial tubes, the airways that carry air to your lungs. It can be acute (short-term, usually from a viral infection) or chronic (long-term, often from smoking). It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid smoking and exposure to secondhand smoke. Practice good hygiene to prevent viral infections (frequent handwashing). Get vaccinated against influenza (flu) and pneumonia. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: An infectious disease caused by bacteria of the genus Brucella, which can be transmitted from animals to humans through direct contact with infected animals, by eating contaminated animal products, or by inhaling airborne agents. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Use protective gear when working with animals at risk of Brucella infection. Consume only pasteurized dairy products and thoroughly cooked meat. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: An eating disorder characterized by a cycle of binge eating followed by behaviors that aim to prevent weight gain, such as vomiting, using laxatives, fasting, or excessive exercise. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Early identification and intervention are crucial. Treatment involves a multidisciplinary approach including psychotherapy (especially cognitive behavioral therapy), nutritional counseling, and medical monitoring. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A bony bump that forms on the joint at the base of your big toe. It occurs when your big toe pushes against your next toe, forcing the joint of your big toe to stick out. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Wear shoes with a wide toe box. Avoid high heels and pointed-toe shoes. Use orthotic devices or shoe inserts for support. Consider bunion pads to cushion the area. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Tissue damage resulting from heat, overexposure to the sun or other radiation, contact with chemicals or electricity. The severity of a burn is classified by the depth of the burn and the percentage of body surface area affected. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Prevent burns by being cautious around heat sources, using sunscreen, storing chemicals safely, and following electrical safety guidelines. Install smoke detectors and carbon monoxide detectors in your home. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Inflammation of one or more bursae, small fluid-filled sacs that cushion the bones, tendons, and muscles near your joints. Bursitis can cause pain and stiffness near the affected joint. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid repetitive movements or prolonged pressure on joints. Use padding or cushions when kneeling or sitting for extended periods. Maintain good posture. Warm up before exercise and stretch afterwards. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A condition that causes numbness, tingling, weakness, and pain in the hand and wrist. It's caused by pressure on the median nerve in the wrist. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid repetitive hand and wrist movements if possible. Take breaks during activities that involve repetitive hand motions. Use ergonomic keyboards and wrist rests. Maintain good posture. Consider wearing a wrist splint, especially at night. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Clouding of the lens of the eye that impairs vision. Cataracts are a common condition that develops with age. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Protect your eyes from UV radiation by wearing sunglasses. Manage underlying conditions like diabetes. Quit smoking. Regular eye exams can help detect cataracts early. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: An immune reaction to eating gluten, a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye. Over time, this reaction damages the small intestine's lining, preventing nutrient absorption. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: The only known treatment is a strict gluten-free diet for life. Read food labels carefully to avoid hidden gluten. Work with a registered dietitian to ensure a balanced gluten-free diet. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A common and potentially serious bacterial skin infection. The affected skin appears swollen, red, and is typically painful and warm to the touch. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Practice good wound care to prevent infection. Keep skin clean and moisturized to prevent cracks. Seek medical attention promptly if you develop signs of skin infection. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A group of disorders that affect a person's ability to move and maintain balance and posture. CP is the most common motor disability in childhood. It is caused by abnormal brain development or damage to the developing brain. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Many cases of cerebral palsy cannot be prevented, but reducing risk factors during pregnancy (e.g., preventing premature birth, managing maternal health conditions) and ensuring safe delivery practices can help. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Cancer that begins in the cells lining the cervix, the lower part of the uterus that opens into the vagina. It is often caused by the human papillomavirus (HPV). It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Get vaccinated against HPV. Practice safe sex to reduce the risk of HPV infection. Undergo regular Pap tests and HPV tests for early detection. Quit smoking. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A small, usually painless lump or cyst on the eyelid. It's caused by a blocked oil gland (meibomian gland). It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Practice good eyelid hygiene: warm compresses and gentle massage of the eyelids can help prevent blockages. Avoid rubbing your eyes. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A highly contagious disease caused by the varicella-zoster virus. It causes an itchy, blister-like rash. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Get vaccinated against chickenpox. Avoid contact with individuals who have chickenpox if you are not immune. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A common sexually transmitted infection (STI) caused by bacteria. Many people with chlamydia have no symptoms. If symptoms occur, they can include pain during urination, abnormal discharge, and pelvic pain. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Practice safe sex: use condoms consistently and correctly. Limit the number of sexual partners. Get tested for STIs regularly, especially if you have new or multiple partners. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: An acute diarrheal illness caused by infection of the intestine with Vibrio cholerae bacteria. People can get cholera by drinking contaminated water or eating contaminated food. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Practice good hygiene: wash hands frequently with soap and water. Drink and use safe water (boiled or treated). Cook food thoroughly. Avoid raw seafood in areas with cholera outbreaks. Get vaccinated against cholera if traveling to high-risk areas. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Also known as myalgic encephalomyelitis (ME), a complex, long-term illness characterized by extreme fatigue that is not improved by rest and is worsened by physical or mental activity. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: The exact causes are not fully understood, and there are no proven ways to prevent CFS. Management focuses on symptom relief and improving quality of life through pacing activities, stress management, and sometimes medication for specific symptoms. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A progressive condition in which the kidneys gradually lose their ability to filter waste and excess fluid from the blood. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Manage underlying conditions like diabetes and high blood pressure. Maintain a healthy weight. Follow a low-salt diet. Avoid overuse of nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs). Quit smoking. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A group of lung diseases that block airflow and make it difficult to breathe. Emphysema and chronic bronchitis are the two main conditions that make up COPD. It is primarily caused by smoking. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Quit smoking. Avoid exposure to secondhand smoke and other lung irritants. Get vaccinated against influenza (flu) and pneumonia. Manage asthma effectively. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Persistent pain that lasts for three months or longer. It can affect any part of the body and can have a significant impact on a person's quality of life, mood, and daily functioning. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Prevention depends on the cause. Practice good posture, use proper lifting techniques, manage underlying medical conditions, and address injuries promptly. Develop healthy coping mechanisms for managing chronic pain if it develops. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Late-stage scarring (fibrosis) of the liver caused by many forms of liver diseases and conditions, such as hepatitis and chronic alcohol abuse. The scarring makes it difficult for the liver to function properly. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid excessive alcohol consumption. Get vaccinated against hepatitis B and C. Manage viral hepatitis effectively. Maintain a healthy weight. Follow a healthy diet. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Birth defects that occur when the lip or mouth does not form properly during pregnancy. A cleft lip is an opening in the upper lip, while a cleft palate is an opening in the roof of the mouth. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: While many cases cannot be prevented, ensuring adequate folic acid intake during pregnancy and avoiding smoking and alcohol may reduce the risk. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Severe, recurring headaches that occur in cycles or clusters. They are characterized by intense pain, usually on one side of the head, often around the eye, and may be accompanied by other symptoms like tearing and nasal congestion. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There is no known way to prevent cluster headaches, but avoiding known triggers like alcohol and smoking during a cluster period may help. Preventive medications can be used to reduce the frequency and severity of attacks. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: An autoimmune disorder triggered by gluten, a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye. Eating gluten damages the lining of the small intestine. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: The only way to manage coeliac disease is to follow a strict gluten-free diet for life. Read food labels carefully. Be aware of cross-contamination. Work with a registered dietitian. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Small, painful, fluid-filled blisters that appear on or around the lips. They are caused by the herpes simplex virus type 1 (HSV-1). It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid close contact with individuals who have cold sores. Do not share personal items like lip balm or eating utensils. Protect your lips from sun exposure, which can trigger outbreaks. Antiviral medications can help manage outbreaks. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Cancer that begins in the colon or rectum. It is the third most common cancer diagnosed in both men and women in the United States. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Get regular colorectal cancer screenings starting at age 45 (or earlier if you have risk factors). Maintain a healthy lifestyle: balanced diet high in fruits, vegetables, and fiber, regular exercise, maintain a healthy weight, avoid smoking, and limit alcohol consumption. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A mild viral infection of the nose and throat (upper respiratory tract). It is highly contagious. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Practice good hygiene: wash hands frequently, avoid touching your face, and cover your mouth and nose when coughing or sneezing. Avoid close contact with individuals who have a cold. Maintain a healthy lifestyle to support your immune system. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A painful condition that occurs when pressure within the muscles builds to dangerous levels. This pressure can decrease blood flow, preventing nourishment and oxygen from reaching nerve and muscle cells. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Prompt medical attention for fractures or severe muscle injuries can help prevent compartment syndrome. Report any severe pain, swelling, or tightness in an injured limb immediately. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Inflammation or infection of the outer membrane of the eyeball and the inner eyelid (conjunctiva). It can be caused by viruses, bacteria, allergens, or irritants. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Practice good hygiene: wash hands frequently, avoid touching your eyes, and do not share personal items like towels or eye makeup. Avoid known allergens if allergic conjunctivitis is the cause. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Infrequent bowel movements or difficulty passing stool. It is a common condition that can be caused by diet, lack of exercise, certain medications, or underlying medical conditions. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Eat a high-fiber diet. Drink plenty of fluids. Engage in regular physical activity. Do not ignore the urge to have a bowel movement. Review medications with your doctor to identify potential causes. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.
