Description: A scratch on the surface of the cornea, the clear front part of the eye. It can be caused by injury, foreign objects, or dry eyes. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Wear protective eyewear during activities that pose a risk of eye injury. Seek prompt medical attention if you experience eye pain, redness, or vision changes after an eye injury. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: The most common type of heart disease, caused by plaque buildup in the arteries that supply blood to the heart (atherosclerosis). This can lead to angina, heart attack, and stroke. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Maintain a healthy lifestyle: balanced diet low in saturated and trans fats, regular exercise, avoid smoking. Manage high blood pressure, high cholesterol, and diabetes. Follow prescribed medications. Reduce stress. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A type of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) that can affect any part of the digestive tract, from the mouth to the anus. It causes inflammation of the lining of your digestive tract, which can lead to abdominal pain, severe diarrhea, fatigue, weight loss and malnutrition. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There is no known way to prevent Crohn's disease. Management focuses on reducing inflammation, relieving symptoms, and achieving remission through medication, lifestyle adjustments, and sometimes surgery. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: An upper airway infection that obstructs breathing and causes a characteristic barking cough. It is most common in young children. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There is no specific way to prevent croup, as it is usually caused by common respiratory viruses. Practice good hygiene to prevent the spread of respiratory infections. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A hormonal disorder caused by prolonged exposure of the body's tissues to high levels of the hormone cortisol. This can be caused by the adrenal glands producing too much cortisol or by taking high doses of corticosteroid medications. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Prevention depends on the cause. If caused by medication, work with your doctor to find the lowest effective dose or alternative treatments. If caused by a tumor, early detection and treatment are important. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: An inherited disorder that causes severe damage to the lungs, digestive system and other organs. Cystic fibrosis affects the cells that produce mucus, sweat and digestive juices. These secreted fluids are normally thin and slippery. But in people with cystic fibrosis, a defective gene causes the secretions to become sticky and thick. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Cystic fibrosis is a genetic disorder and cannot be prevented. Genetic testing is available for individuals with a family history of CF who are planning to have children. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Inflammation of the bladder, often caused by a bacterial infection (urinary tract infection - UTI). Symptoms include frequent and painful urination, and a persistent urge to urinate. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Drink plenty of fluids. Wipe from front to back after using the toilet (for women). Urinate after sexual activity. Avoid irritants like scented feminine products. Consider cranberry products, although evidence of effectiveness is mixed. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A blood clot that forms in a deep vein, usually in the legs. DVT can be serious because the clot can travel through the bloodstream and lodge in the lungs, causing a pulmonary embolism. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Stay active and move your legs during long periods of sitting or travel. Maintain a healthy weight. Manage underlying conditions like heart disease and cancer. Follow prescribed blood-thinning medications if you are at high risk. Wear compression stockings as recommended by your doctor. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A condition that occurs when you use or lose more fluid than you take in, and your body doesn't have enough water and other fluids to carry out its normal functions. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Drink plenty of fluids throughout the day, especially during hot weather and exercise. Eat foods with high water content (fruits and vegetables). Be aware of conditions that can increase fluid loss (e.g., vomiting, diarrhea, fever). Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A group of symptoms affecting memory, thinking and social abilities severely enough to interfere with your daily life. Alzheimer's disease is the most common cause of dementia. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: While not all types of dementia can be prevented, adopting a healthy lifestyle (balanced diet, regular exercise, social engagement, mental stimulation), managing cardiovascular risk factors, and preventing head injuries may reduce the risk of some types. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Also known as tooth decay or caries, these are holes in your teeth caused by plaque buildup, bacteria, and acid erosion. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Brush your teeth at least twice a day with fluoride toothpaste. Floss daily. Limit sugary and acidic foods and drinks. Get regular dental check-ups and cleanings. Consider fluoride treatments or sealants. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A common and serious mood disorder that negatively affects how you feel, the way you think and how you act. It can cause feelings of sadness and/or a loss of interest in activities you once enjoyed. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Develop healthy coping mechanisms for stress (e.g., exercise, relaxation techniques, mindfulness). Seek therapy, such as cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) or interpersonal therapy (IPT). Consider medication as prescribed by a psychiatrist. Build a strong support network. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A general term that describes inflammation of the skin. It can have many causes and forms, including eczema, contact dermatitis, and seborrheic dermatitis. Symptoms can include rash, itching, and dry skin. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Prevention depends on the type of dermatitis. Avoid known irritants and allergens. Keep skin moisturized. Use gentle, fragrance-free skincare products. Manage stress. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A condition in which a child is delayed in reaching developmental milestones compared to other children of the same age. These milestones can include language, motor skills, social skills, and thinking skills. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Many developmental delays cannot be prevented, but ensuring good prenatal care, avoiding exposure to toxins during pregnancy, and providing a stimulating and supportive environment for the child can be beneficial. Early identification and intervention with therapies and support are crucial. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A chronic condition in which the pancreas produces little or no insulin. Insulin is a hormone needed to allow sugar (glucose) to enter cells to produce energy. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Type 1 diabetes is an autoimmune disease and cannot be prevented. Management focuses on controlling blood sugar levels through insulin therapy, diet, and exercise. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A chronic condition that affects the way the body metabolizes sugar (glucose). With type 2 diabetes, the body either resists the effects of insulin — a hormone that regulates the movement of sugar into your cells — or doesn't produce enough insulin to maintain a normal glucose level. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Maintain a healthy weight. Engage in regular physical activity. Eat a balanced diet low in sugar and refined carbohydrates. Manage blood pressure and cholesterol levels. Regular screening is important, especially for those with risk factors. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A serious complication of diabetes that occurs when your body produces excess blood acids (ketones). It develops when your body doesn't have enough insulin to allow blood sugar into your cells for energy. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Manage diabetes effectively by following your treatment plan, including insulin therapy, diet, and blood sugar monitoring. Learn to recognize the early symptoms of DKA (e.g., excessive thirst, frequent urination, nausea, abdominal pain). Seek immediate medical attention if you suspect DKA. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Kidney damage caused by diabetes. Over time, high blood sugar levels can damage the filtering units (glomeruli) in the kidneys. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Manage blood sugar levels effectively through diet, exercise, and medication. Control high blood pressure. Follow a low-protein diet as recommended by your doctor. Regular kidney function tests are important for early detection and management. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Damage to the blood vessels in the retina (the light-sensitive tissue at the back of the eye) caused by diabetes. It can lead to vision loss and blindness. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Manage blood sugar levels effectively. Control high blood pressure. Get regular comprehensive eye exams with dilation. Early detection and treatment (e.g., laser surgery, injections) can help prevent vision loss. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Frequent, loose, watery bowel movements. It can be caused by viral or bacterial infections, food poisoning, medications, or underlying medical conditions. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Practice good hygiene: wash hands frequently. Ensure food is cooked and stored properly. Drink safe water. Avoid sharing personal items. Manage underlying medical conditions. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Inflammation or infection in one or more small pouches in the digestive tract (diverticula). It can cause abdominal pain, fever, nausea, and changes in bowel habits. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Eat a high-fiber diet to help prevent diverticulosis (the presence of diverticula). Stay hydrated. Avoid straining during bowel movements. Seek medical attention for symptoms of diverticulitis. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: The presence of small pouches (diverticula) in the wall of the colon. It often doesn't cause any symptoms. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Eat a high-fiber diet. Stay hydrated. Regular exercise may be beneficial. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A sensation of lightheadedness, unsteadiness, or a feeling that you are spinning or that your surroundings are spinning. It can have many causes, including inner ear problems, low blood pressure, and certain medications. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Prevent falls by taking precautions such as using handrails and avoiding slippery surfaces. Manage underlying medical conditions. Avoid sudden changes in position. Stay hydrated. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A genetic disorder caused when abnormal cell division results in an extra full or partial copy of chromosome 21. This extra genetic material causes the developmental changes and physical features of Down syndrome. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Down syndrome is a genetic condition and cannot be prevented. Prenatal screening tests are available to assess the risk of having a baby with Down syndrome. Early intervention and support services can help individuals with Down syndrome reach their full potential. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A common condition that occurs when your tears aren't able to provide adequate lubrication for your eyes. This can cause discomfort, irritation, and vision problems. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid dry environments and wind. Use artificial tears regularly. Increase humidity in your home or workplace. Take breaks during prolonged screen time. Consider punctal plugs to reduce tear drainage. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A learning disorder that involves difficulty reading due to problems identifying speech sounds and learning how they relate to letters and words (decoding). It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Dyslexia is a neurobiological condition and cannot be prevented. Early identification and specialized instruction in reading and language skills are crucial for helping individuals with dyslexia succeed. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Difficulty swallowing. It can be caused by various conditions, including neurological disorders, structural problems in the throat or esophagus, and certain medical treatments. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Eat slowly and chew food thoroughly. Sit upright while eating. Modify food textures as recommended by a speech therapist. Seek medical evaluation to determine the cause of dysphagia. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: An infection of the middle ear, the space behind the eardrum that contains tiny vibrating bones. It is common in children. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Practice good hygiene to prevent the spread of respiratory infections. Avoid exposure to secondhand smoke. Ensure children receive recommended vaccinations. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A group of conditions marked by an unhealthy preoccupation with food and weight. Common eating disorders include anorexia nervosa, bulimia nervosa, and binge eating disorder. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Early identification and intervention are crucial. Treatment involves a multidisciplinary approach including medical care, nutritional rehabilitation, and psychotherapy. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A chronic condition that causes itchy, inflamed skin. It is common in children but can occur at any age. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid known irritants and allergens. Keep skin moisturized regularly. Use gentle, fragrance-free skincare products. Manage stress. Identify and avoid food triggers in some cases. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Swelling caused by excess fluid trapped in your body's tissues. It can occur in any part of the body, but is most common in the legs and ankles. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Manage underlying medical conditions such as heart failure, kidney disease, and liver disease. Reduce salt intake. Elevate the affected limb. Wear compression stockings. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A condition in which tissue similar to the lining of the uterus (endometrium) grows outside the uterus. It can cause pelvic pain, heavy periods, and infertility. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There are no known ways to prevent endometriosis. Management focuses on pain relief and slowing the growth of the tissue through medication, hormone therapy, and/or surgery. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: An increase in the size of the prostate gland, a common condition as men age. It can cause urinary problems such as frequent urination, difficulty starting urination, and a weak urine stream. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There are no proven ways to prevent BPH. Maintaining a healthy lifestyle, including regular exercise and a balanced diet, may be beneficial overall. Regular check-ups with a doctor are important for early detection and management. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Painful conditions that affect the tendons in your elbow. Tennis elbow (lateral epicondylitis) causes pain on the outside of the elbow, while golfer's elbow (medial epicondylitis) causes pain on the inside. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid repetitive motions of the wrist and arm. Use proper technique during sports and activities. Take breaks during activities that strain the elbow. Use supportive braces or straps. Strengthen the muscles of the forearm and wrist. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A neurological disorder characterized by recurrent seizures, which are sudden, uncontrolled electrical disturbances in the brain. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Prevent head injuries by wearing protective gear. Manage underlying medical conditions that can trigger seizures. Follow prescribed anti-epileptic medications consistently. Avoid known seizure triggers such as sleep deprivation and stress. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: The inability to get and keep an erection firm enough for sex. It can be caused by physical or psychological factors. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Manage underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, and high blood pressure. Maintain a healthy lifestyle: balanced diet, regular exercise, avoid smoking, and limit alcohol consumption. Reduce stress and anxiety. Seek psychological counseling if needed. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Cancer that occurs in the esophagus, the long, hollow tube that runs from your throat to your stomach. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Quit smoking. Maintain a healthy weight. Treat chronic heartburn (GERD). Limit alcohol consumption. Eat a diet rich in fruits and vegetables. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A neurological disorder that causes involuntary and rhythmic shaking. It can affect almost any part of your body, but most commonly the hands, especially during voluntary movements. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There is no known way to prevent essential tremor. Management focuses on reducing tremor severity with medications, therapy, and sometimes surgery. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Small spots that drift through your field of vision. They are usually harmless and occur with age as the jelly-like substance inside your eyes (vitreous) becomes more liquid. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Most floaters are not preventable and are a normal part of aging. Seek prompt medical attention if you experience a sudden increase in floaters, flashes of light, or peripheral vision loss, as these could indicate a more serious condition. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A term used to describe infants and children who are not gaining weight or growing as expected compared to standard growth charts for their age and sex. It can have various underlying medical or environmental causes. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Ensure adequate nutrition and feeding practices. Address any underlying medical conditions that may be affecting growth. Provide a supportive and stimulating environment for the child. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: An event which results in a person coming to rest inadvertently on the ground or other lower level. Falls are a major cause of injury, especially in older adults. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Prevent falls by addressing risk factors such as muscle weakness, balance problems, vision impairment, and home hazards (e.g., loose rugs, poor lighting). Engage in exercises to improve strength and balance. Have regular vision checks. Wear appropriate footwear. Modify your home environment to make it safer. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A common vision condition in which distant objects may be seen more clearly than objects that are near. It occurs when the eyeball is shorter than normal or the cornea has too little curvature. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Farsightedness is often due to genetics and not preventable. It is typically corrected with eyeglasses, contact lenses, or refractive surgery. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A feeling of extreme tiredness or lack of energy. It is a common symptom of many medical conditions and can also be caused by lifestyle factors or psychological issues. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Address underlying medical conditions that may be causing fatigue. Maintain a healthy lifestyle: balanced diet, regular exercise, adequate sleep, and stress management. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A temporary increase in your body temperature, often due to an illness. It is a sign that your body is fighting off an infection. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Prevent infections by practicing good hygiene (frequent handwashing), avoiding close contact with sick individuals, and getting recommended vaccinations. Manage fever with rest, fluids, and over-the-counter medications if needed. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A common condition in women characterized by lumpy, often tender breasts. These changes are related to hormonal fluctuations during the menstrual cycle. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There are no known ways to prevent fibrocystic breast changes. Self-exams and regular clinical breast exams are important for detecting any new or unusual lumps that may require further evaluation. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A chronic condition characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain accompanied by fatigue, sleep, memory and mood issues. Researchers believe that fibromyalgia amplifies painful sensations by affecting the way your brain and spinal cord process painful and nonpainful signals. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There is no known way to prevent fibromyalgia. Management focuses on reducing symptoms and improving quality of life through medication, therapy, exercise, and stress management. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A mild viral illness that is common in children. It is caused by human parvovirus B19 and often results in a distinctive red rash on the face that looks like a slapped cheek. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There is no vaccine to prevent fifth disease. Practice good hygiene to help prevent the spread of the virus. Pregnant women should avoid contact with individuals who have fifth disease, as it can pose risks to the fetus. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A condition in which the arches on the inside of the feet are flattened, allowing the entire sole of the foot to touch the floor when standing. It can be a normal variation or caused by underlying conditions. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Many cases of flat feet are not preventable, especially if they are congenital. Wearing supportive footwear and using orthotic arch supports may help manage symptoms and prevent complications. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Illness caused by eating contaminated food. Common symptoms include nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and abdominal cramps. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Practice safe food handling and preparation: wash hands and surfaces often, cook food to the proper temperature, refrigerate perishable foods promptly, and avoid cross-contamination. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: An immune system reaction that occurs soon after eating a certain food. Even a tiny amount of the allergy-causing food can trigger signs and symptoms such as hives, itching, swelling, vomiting, diarrhea, and in severe cases, anaphylaxis. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: The most effective way to prevent a food allergy reaction is to strictly avoid the food that causes the allergy. Read food labels carefully. Inform restaurant staff about your allergies. Carry an epinephrine auto-injector if you have a history of severe allergic reactions. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A break in a bone. Fractures can range from a hairline crack to a complete break. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Prevent falls by taking precautions such as using handrails and ensuring good lighting. Wear appropriate protective gear during sports and other activities. Maintain adequate calcium and vitamin D intake to promote bone health. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Hard deposits that form in the gallbladder, a small organ located beneath the liver that stores and releases bile. They can range in size from as small as a grain of sand to as large as a golf ball. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: While not always preventable, maintaining a healthy weight, eating a high-fiber diet, and avoiding rapid weight loss may reduce the risk. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Inflammation of the lining of the stomach. It can be caused by infection, overuse of certain pain relievers, excessive alcohol consumption, stress, or autoimmune disorders. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid excessive alcohol consumption. Use NSAIDs sparingly and with food. Manage stress. Practice good hygiene to prevent H. pylori infection. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Inflammation of the stomach and intestines, typically caused by a viral or bacterial infection. Symptoms include nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal cramps, and sometimes fever. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Practice good hygiene: wash hands frequently, especially after using the toilet and before eating. Avoid sharing personal items. Ensure food is cooked and stored properly. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A chronic digestive disease that occurs when stomach acid or, occasionally, stomach content flows back into the esophagus. This backwash (acid reflux) can irritate the lining of your esophagus. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid large meals. Don't lie down immediately after eating. Elevate the head of your bed. Avoid trigger foods such as fatty or spicy foods, caffeine, and alcohol. Maintain a healthy weight. Quit smoking. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A common sexually transmitted infection (STI) caused by the herpes simplex virus (HSV). It can cause painful sores on the genitals, buttocks, or thighs. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Practice safe sex: use condoms consistently and correctly. Limit the number of sexual partners. Be aware that even without visible sores, the virus can still be transmitted. Antiviral medications can help manage outbreaks. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: Small, fleshy growths on the genitals, caused by the human papillomavirus (HPV). They are a common sexually transmitted infection (STI). It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Get vaccinated against HPV. Practice safe sex: use condoms consistently and correctly. Limit the number of sexual partners. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A type of diabetes that develops during pregnancy in women who didn't have diabetes before. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: While not always preventable, maintaining a healthy weight before pregnancy, eating a healthy diet, and exercising regularly can reduce the risk. Women are typically screened for gestational diabetes during pregnancy. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: An early form of gum disease (periodontal disease) that causes inflammation of the gums. Symptoms include red, swollen, and bleeding gums. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Practice good oral hygiene: brush your teeth at least twice a day, floss daily, and get regular dental check-ups and cleanings. Avoid smoking. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A group of eye diseases that damage the optic nerve, often due to an abnormally high pressure inside your eye. Glaucoma can lead to vision loss and blindness if left untreated. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Regular comprehensive eye exams with pressure checks are crucial for early detection. There is no proven way to prevent most types of glaucoma, but early treatment can help slow progression. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A common and complex form of arthritis that can affect anyone. It's characterized by sudden, severe attacks of pain, redness and tenderness in one joint, most often the joint at the base of the big toe. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Maintain a healthy weight. Limit alcohol consumption. Avoid sugary drinks and foods high in purines (e.g., red meat, organ meats, some seafood). Stay hydrated. Medications can help prevent gout attacks and reduce uric acid levels. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: An autoimmune disorder that causes hyperthyroidism (overactive thyroid). The thyroid gland produces too much thyroid hormone. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: There is no known way to prevent Graves' disease. Management focuses on reducing thyroid hormone production with medications, radioactive iodine therapy, or surgery. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A genetic bleeding disorder where blood doesn't clot properly due to a lack of clotting factors. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid injuries and certain medications that affect clotting. Treatment involves clotting factor replacement therapy. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A chronic bacterial infection caused by Mycobacterium leprae, affecting the skin, nerves, and mucous membranes. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Early detection and treatment with antibiotics. Avoid prolonged close contact with untreated patients. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A severe respiratory disease caused by hantaviruses, spread through rodent urine, droppings, or saliva. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Avoid contact with rodent-infested areas. No specific treatment—supportive care is needed. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A viral infection that causes cold sores (HSV-1) or genital herpes (HSV-2). It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Practice safe sex and avoid contact with active lesions. Treated with antiviral medications. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A condition in which the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormones, leading to fatigue, weight gain, and slow metabolism. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Regular thyroid function monitoring. Treated with thyroid hormone replacement therapy. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A condition where the thyroid gland produces excess thyroid hormones, leading to weight loss, rapid heartbeat, and nervousness. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Regular thyroid monitoring and lifestyle adjustments. Treatment includes medications, radioactive iodine, or surgery. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A condition where blood sugar levels drop too low, causing dizziness, confusion, and in severe cases, unconsciousness. It is important to seek immediate medical advice for an accurate diagnosis, to receive appropriate treatment options tailored to the individual's needs, and to effectively manage the disease while preventing possible complications.
Precaution: Monitor blood sugar regularly, eat balanced meals. Immediate treatment includes consuming glucose or sugar-rich foods. Maintain regular follow-ups with your healthcare provider.

Description: A condition characterized by high blood sugar levels, often seen in diabetes.
